item.title: Great decoupling and rise of sovereign AI
item.description: IN THE sleek boardrooms of London, Singapore and Dubai, the traditional narrative of the global artificial intelligence race is being rewritten. For years, the prevailing story was one of a singular American lead — a monopoly on high-end semiconductors and closed-door innovation. Yet, by December 2025, a more inclusive reality has emerged. It is a reality where the......

item.title: Nipah in winter: deadly threat Bangladesh continues to ignore
item.description: WINTER is here. One familiar and widely cherished scene during this season is the excitement of city boys and girls who wake up early and travel in groups to the outskirts of Dhaka to drink fresh date palm sap. Yet within this seemingly harmless ritual lies a danger so silent and invisible that most people fail to grasp its severity. Only those who have lost a family......

item.title: Rising stakes of food economy
item.description: ON A humid morning in rural Rangpur, a tractor rattles past a cluster of smallholdings where women sort seed potatoes while a teenager scrolls an app showing market prices. That daily choreography — field, cold-room, truck, market and kitchen — now defines a national story: Bangladesh’s food economy is shifting from subsistence farming toward a complex......

item.title: Poverty and corruption
item.description: BANGLADESH today stands trapped inside two interconnected circles, poverty and corruption, like a nation caught on a spinning, grinding wheel. One suffocates households from below, the other hollows out institutions from above; one deprives citizens of nutrition, education, mobility and hope, while the other deprives the state of leadership, trust and moral legitimacy......

item.title: Vigilantism, impunity, worrying crisis of governance
item.description: THE killing of a Hindu young man and the burning of his body at Bhaluka in Mymensingh on December 18 by an organised mob on allegations that he had hurt religious sentiments once again raises a few serious questions about law and order. The young man, who worked with an apparel factory, was beaten to death by what appears to have been an organised mob, which......

item.title: An attack on media and democratic way of life
item.description: THE attack on the media that took place for hours beginning late December 18, centring on the death of Sharif Osman Hadi, a noted face of the July 2024 uprising and spokesperson of Inquilab Mancha, is heinous. Osman Hadi died early that night while being treated in Singapore after he had been shot at in Dhaka on December 12. We are much saddened by his murder......
